fields.name: articlesByLocation
fields.description: Returns the articles currently enroute to, or awaiting collection from, a given location or set of locations. Either 'fromLocation' or 'toLocation' should be provided.

args.name: status
args.description: Filter results by Article status (e.g. AWAITING_ARRIVAL vs AWAITING_COLLECTION)

args.name: orderType
args.description: Filter results by Order type (e.g. HD vs CC)

args.name: fromLocation
args.description: Find Articles that are coming from these locations (typically used for collection-type scenarios)

args.name: toLocation
args.description: Find Articles that are moving to these locations (typically used for arrivals-type scenarios)

args.name: orderRef
args.description: Filter results by Order ref

args.name: customerFirstName
args.description: Filter results by Customer first name

args.name: customerLastName
args.description: Filter results by Customer last name

args.name: customerPhone
args.description: Filter results by Customer phone

args.name: customerEmail
args.description: Filter results by Customer email

args.name: createdOn
args.description: Filter results by Articles created in a given date range (typically used for uncollected-type scenarios)

args.name: consignmentStatus
args.description: Filter results by Consignment status

args.name: carrierName
args.description: Filter results by Carrier name

args.name: retailerId
args.description: Filter results by Retailer id

args.name: first
args.description: Return the first N results. Max page size allowed is 500

args.name: last
args.description: Return the last N results. Max page size allowed is 500

args.name: before
args.description: Return results before this cursor

args.name: after
args.description: Return results after this cursor

fields.name: searchVirtualInventory
fields.description: This query searches the virtual inventory to return locations and available-to-sell stock for the requested products and their given quantities.

args.name: virtualCatalogue
args.description: Reference identifier for the `VirtualCatalogue` that will be searched

args.name: virtualPosition
args.description: Identifier for the `VirtualPosition` that will be searched

args.name: productQuantities
args.description: An array of products with their requested quantities

args.name: excludedLocationRefs
args.description: An array of references of `Location` objects that will be excluded from this search should this parameter be passed

args.name: orderByProximity
args.description: GeoCoordinates to order results by. Closest locations are returned first. If this parameter is not passed, results will be in no specific order

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first n elements from the list

fields.name: virtualView
fields.description:
_Disclaimer: This query is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Find a `VirtualView` entity

fields.name: virtualViewInventoryLevels
fields.description:
_Disclaimer: This query is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

This query searches a Virtual View to find locations that contain the required stock of products and provide that data as available inventory levels. The query looks into the buffered inventory of the locations. The maximum number of locations returned by this query is 100.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first n elements from the list

types.name: Setting
types.description:
Represents configuration settings. Settings are quite versatile. These can be used in feature toggles or rules to accomplish insane variety of functions.

**USAGE**
Use a unique combination of `context` and `contextId` to create settings for various contexts. Not using a unique combination of those two will result in a _ConstraintViolationException_.

**NOTE**
If you are an existing client, you may already be using our Configuration Settings feature. You can still use this API to create new settings and update existing ones. However, we advise you to be very cautious in doing so as _V4_ APIs may behave unexpectedly if you modify your existing settings. If you have questions, please contact support.

types.name: ProductCatalogue
types.description:
The `ProductCatalogue` is a structure that supports a grouping of product and category data. The `ref` field will be the unique identifier for this catalogue.

The `ProductCatalogue` is an orchestrateable entity, and the parent type for all `Product` and `Category` orchestration events.

**Backward Compatibility Note**

With the introduction of Global Inventory, we have introduced new data structures to support this functionality. Existing orchestration enabled clients will have access to their existing product based data via the `COMPATIBILITY:` catalogue.

For more information, please refer to the Backward Compatibility Guide on Lingo

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the object. For internal use, should not be used externally or by any business logic

fields.name: ref

fields.name: type

fields.name: workflowRef
fields.description: The reference used for workflow identification. This is defined by a combination of the entity name and the type, in the format [EntityName]::[Type]. For example, an Order of type CC will have the workflowRef "ORDER::CC".

fields.name: workflowVersion
fields.description: The version of the workflow assigned to the entity and used for workflow identification. It comprises a major version and minor version number.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
The current status of the `ProductCatalogue`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration

types.name: Attribute
types.description:
An `attribute` is a trio of *name*, *type* and *value*. Attributes are useful for storing additional information into objects.


**USAGE**
Attributes should be unique by `name`. If an attribute with a matching `name` already exists, then the `type` and `value` fields will be updated, else they will be inserted.

types.name: Category
types.description:
A `Category` can be associated with Product Catalogues and Products. It has a tree-like structure, where each Category may contain a parent category, and / or one or more child categories. This new Category structure allows support for more advanced category hierarchies. The `ref` field will be the unique identifier for this Category within the specified Product Catalogue, as identified by the `catalogue` field.

The `Category` is an orchestrateable entity. Events for these should specify a parent entity of Product Catalogue.

**Backward Compatibility Note**

With the introduction of Global Inventory, we have introduced new data structures to support this functionality. Existing orchestration enabled clients will have access to their existing product based data via the `COMPATIBILITY:` catalogue.

For more information, please refer to the Backward Compatibility Guide on Lingo

types.name: DateRange
types.description:
Type to be used for comparisons on `DateTime` type fields. All `DateTime` comparisons will be done by converting the values in the UTC format. If a `DateTime` value does not contain timezone information, it is assumed to be UTC. The results will also be in the UTC format.
This type can be used for identifying records
* _on_ a given date and/or timestamp. * _on_ and _after_ a given date and/or timestamp. * _after_ a given date and/or time. * _on_ and _before_ a given date and/or timestamp. * _before_ a given date and/or timestamp. * _between_ two dates/timestamps with the input dates/timestamps excluded. * _between_ two dates/timestamps with the input dates/timestamps included.
Please note that all date comparisons assume that all `DateTime` # values are sent in a valid ISO8601 format. Please see [ISO8601 documentation] (https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html) to see valid `DateTime` formats.

**USAGE**
You must pass at least one of the `from` or `to` fields. Requests missing both of these fields will result in error.

inputFields.name: from
inputFields.description: `DateTime` in a valid ISO8601 format for identifying records _after_ or _at_ the given timestamp. If this field is not passed in the request, the response will contain all records from the beginning of time till the `to` date.

inputFields.name: to
inputFields.description: `DateTime` in a valid ISO8601 format for identifying records _before_ or _at_ the given timestamp. If this field is not passed in the request, the response will contain all records after the `from` date.

types.name: Product
types.description:
The `Product` interface identifies a type that is, and is treated like, a Product.

There are currently 3 Product implementations available that represent the most common product type abstractions within the Product domain:
* `StandardProduct` - An ordinary Product structure. * `VariantProduct` - A variation based Product structure which can have a Standard Product as a base. Variation examples include 'Size', 'Color', 'Volume', 'Flavour', etc. and can be managed with the `attributes` field. * `GroupProduct` - A group Product structure. A Group Product can contain multiple other products, of any Product type.

fields.name: summary
fields.description: A short description of the product (max 255 chars)

fields.name: prices
fields.description: A list of prices for the product

types.name: Fulfilment
types.description:
A `Fulfilment` represents one or more items in an order that need to be picked & packed for the customer.
A fulfilment is assigned to a location based on the retailer's fulfilment rules and available inventory. A fulfilment will have an origin (from) and destination (to) associated with it.

A type to define a role and the boundaries within which that role is valid. For instance, a store associate can only be authorised to view particulars of their own store
 whereas a store manager can be authorised to view particulars of multiple stores.

types.name: VirtualView
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

A `VirtualView` object provides on-hand and buffered view of the inventory. The buffers are calculated based on a specific set of inventory controls which are associated with the Virtual View at the time of creation.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: A unique reference. Note: Virtual View refs do not support the hash (#) character.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Represents the current status of the Virtual View. Please see user guide to learn about the status lifecycle of a Virtual View.

fields.name: inventoryControlsId
fields.description: The identifier for the DecisionTable that contains the inventory controls for this VirtualView.

fields.name: virtualProducts
fields.description: A list of `VirtualProducts` within this Virtual View. A Virtual View returns `VirtualProducts` only when it is in the 'ACTIVE' status.

args.description: Type of the product

args.name: ref
args.description: Reference of the product

args.description: Returns the first n elements from the list

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last n elements from the list

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified global ID

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified global ID

types.name: VirtualViewStatus
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Represents the status of a Virtual View. A Virtual View can be in one of the three statuses in its lifecycle. Each of them is described below.

enumValues.name: CREATED
enumValues.description: Status for a newly created Virtual View. This status represents that the Virtual View has been created but it has not started loading the inventory yet.

enumValues.name: LOADING
enumValues.description: Represents that a newly created Virtual View is loading inventory in the background.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: Represents that the Virtual View is ready to be queried for virtual products. A Virtual View is expected to remain in this status for its lifespan.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: Represents that the Virtual View was created but there was error in loading the inventory. This is usually due to a server issue. We recommend creating a new virtual view when this happens. If the problem persists, please call Fluent support.

types.name: VirtualProduct
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

A `VirtualProduct` object provides aggregated as well as location based `onHand` and `available` inventory for a given product.

fields.name: gtin
fields.description:
Global trade item number: Globally unique 14 digit number to uniquely identify an item. We allow 20 characters as support for legacy clients. If you are not a legacy client, we recommend not exceeding the standard 14 digits. </br>
 Max character limit: 20.

fields.name: onHand
fields.description: Represents number of items in the inventory without the buffer applied

fields.name: available
fields.description: Represents number of items in the inventory with the buffers applied

fields.name: buffer
fields.description: Represents the total buffer calculated as per the inventory controls. Please note that buffers are always subtracted from the on-hand quantities. So a negative buffer will result in addition.

fields.name: virtualInventoryPositions
fields.description: A list of `VirtualInventoryPosition` for this product.

fields.name: available

types.name: VirtualViewInventoryLevelsInput
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Input type for the `virtualViewInventoryLevels` query.

inputFields.name: virtualViewRef
inputFields.description: Reference of the Virtual View that will be searched.

inputFields.name: productQuantities
inputFields.description: An object containing requested products along with the quantities required.

inputFields.name: includedLocationRefs
inputFields.description: A list of locations within the Virtual View's network. The search will be confined to these locations.

inputFields.name: orderByProximity
inputFields.description:
GeoCoordinates to order results by. Closest locations are returned first. If this parameter is not passed, results will be in no specific order.
 Please note that we use the great-circle distance for this sorting and these distances are calculated based on an implementation of the Haversine formula.

types.name: DecisionRule
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

A DecisionRule is a set of conditions along with actions that must be performed if the conditions evaluate to true.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A short description of the rule. Helpful to understand the behaviour when the rule itself is complicated.

fields.name: inputs
fields.description: A set of conditions that ALL need to be true for the input to evaluate to true.

fields.name: outputs
fields.description:
A set of actions to be taken when the input evaluates to true.
Note: Currently we support only one action. The type is list for future support.

fields.name: priority
fields.description: The priority decides which rule to execute in case of conflict between multiple rules. The rule with the highest priority (represented by lowest number) will be selected. If no priority is provided, each rule will get a priority of 100 by default.

types.name: DecisionRuleInput
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Represents the input conditions for a `DecisionRule`.

fields.name: inputExpression
fields.description: The left hand side of a condition equation. At the moment, the actions are executed only when the `inputExpression` evaluates to true. So, it should be designed such that the true value should lead to the execution of the action.

fields.name: inputEntries
fields.description: This represents the right hand side of the condition equation. It includes the input values.

types.name: DecisionRuleInputExpression
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

The input expression. At the moment, output actions are executed when DecisionRuleInputExpression evaluates to true. So, this should be designed such that it evaluates to true for the corresponding action to be performed. Note: A rule can have multiple input expressions chained together with logical operators. Currently the api uses the "AND" operator to chain multiple input expressions within a rule.

types.name: DecisionRuleInputFieldName
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Enumerates the supported fields for use in input expressions.

enumValues.name: CATEGORY_REF
enumValues.description: Enum value for category ref. To be used when decision rule input is based on the ref/s of the product's category.

enumValues.name: LOCATION_STATUS
enumValues.description: Enum value for location status. To be used when decision rule input is based on the status/es of the product's location.

enumValues.name: LOCATION_REF
enumValues.description: Enum value for location ref. To be used when decision rule input is based on the ref/s of the location.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_STATUS
enumValues.description: Enum value for product status. To be used when decision rule input is based on the status/es of the product. The type of the product i.e. STANDARD or VARIANT doesn't matter.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_ATTRIBUTE
enumValues.description: Search by attribute. Corresponding stringEntires should be of the format <<attributename>>:<<attributevalue>>. Where value of the attribute doesn't matter, <<attributevalue>> should be replaced by the asterix character `*`.

enumValues.name: STANDARDPRODUCT_REF
enumValues.description: Enum value for standard product ref. To be used when decision rule input is based on the ref/s of the standard products.

enumValues.name: VARIANTPRODUCT_REF
enumValues.description: Enum value for variant product ref. To be used when decision rule input is based on the ref/s of the variant products.

types.name: DecisionRuleComparisionOperator
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Enumerates the supported operators for use in input expressions.

enumValues.name: IN
enumValues.description: Determines whether the value of an expression is equal to any of the several values in a specified list.

enumValues.name: NOT_IN
enumValues.description: Determines whether the value of an expression is not equal to any of the several values in a specified list.

types.name: DecisionRuleInputEntries
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

This represents the values that the input expression will be compared to. Think of these as the right hand side of the condition equation.

fields.name: stringEntries
fields.description: Values that the input expression will be compared to. This field should be used when values of the corresponding fields are strings. For example, value of Product.Ref will be string or a value that can be parsed or converted into a string.

types.name: DecisionRuleOutput
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Represents a single action to be performed when input conditions as configured via `DecisionRuleInput` are evaluated to true. A single DecisionRule can have multiple DecisionRuleOutput associated with it, each corresponding to a single action.

fields.name: outputExpression
fields.description: The output expression. At the moment, we execute actions/outputs when DecisionRuleInputExpression evaluates to true. So, this should be designed such that this will always be executed when the input evaluates to true. Also note that even though we don't support logical expressions as outputs at the moment, the schema type is designed this way to be future proof.

fields.name: outputEntries
fields.description: This represents the values that the output expression will be compared to.

types.name: DecisionRuleOutputExpression
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

The output expression. At the moment, we execute actions/outputs when DecisionRuleInputExpression evaluates to true. So, this should be designed such that this will always be executed when the input evaluates to true. Also note that at the moment, we don't support logical expressions as outputs. The schema naming is designed this way to be future proof.

types.name: DecisionRuleOutputAction
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Supported actions for output in the decision table.

enumValues.name: APPLY_QUANTITY_BUFFER_ALLOW_NEGATIVE_AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: This action applies a quantity buffer. It directly subtracts the corresponding buffer quantity from on-hand quantity. The resulting 'available' values are a direct result of the subtraction (on-hand - buffer) and, thus, can be negative when buffer > on-hand. This impacts the aggregate "available" values accordingly. For the calculation algorithm, please refer to the User Guide.

enumValues.name: APPLY_QUANTITY_BUFFER_RESET_NEGATIVE_AVAILABLE_TO_ZERO
enumValues.description: This action applies a quantity buffer by directly subtracting the corresponding buffer quantity from on-hand quantity. The resulting 'available' values are a direct result of the subtraction (on-hand - buffer) and, thus, can be negative when buffer > on-hand. In case when an 'available' quantity becomes negative, this action resets it to 0 so that negative available quantities do not eat into the aggregate available values. For the calculation algorithm, please refer to the User Guide.

enumValues.name: APPLY_EXCLUSION_BUFFER
enumValues.description: This action applies an exclusion buffer. This buffer is meant to exclude items by setting the available quantity to 0. Please note that exclusion buffers do not need a corresponding `DecisionRuleOutputEntries`. If an entry is provided, they will be ignored in the buffer calculation.

types.name: DecisionRuleOutputEntries
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

This represents the values of the output expressions.

fields.name: intEntry
fields.description: Values that the output expression will be compared to. To be used when the values are a single Int. For example, for the Output "Apply a quantity buffer of 10, this is the `10` part.”

types.name: InventoryCatalogue
types.description:
The `InventoryCatalogue` is a structure that supports a grouping of inventory position data. The `ref` field will be the unique identifier for this catalogue.

The `InventoryCatalogue` is an orchestrateable entity, and the parent type for all `InventoryPosition` and `InventoryQuantity` orchestration events.

**Backward Compatibility Note**

With the introduction of Global Inventory, we have introduced new data structures to support this functionality. Existing orchestration enabled clients will have access to their existing product based data via the `COMPATIBILITY:` catalogue.

For more information, please refer to the Backward Compatibility Guide on Lingo

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the object. For internal use, should not be used externally or by any business logic

fields.name: ref
fields.description: The unique reference identifier for the Inventory Catalogue

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the `InventoryCatalogue`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.

fields.name: workflowRef
fields.description: The reference used for workflow identification. This is defined by a combination of the entity name and the type, in the format [EntityName]::[Type]. For example, an Order of type CC will have the workflowRef "ORDER::CC".

fields.name: workflowVersion
fields.description: The version of the workflow assigned to the entity and used for workflow identification. It comprises a major version and minor version number.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
The current status of the `InventoryCatalogue`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration

types.name: InventoryPosition
types.description:
An `InventoryPosition` provides an "on hand" calculation of available inventory, based on it's associated Inventory Quantities and Location. The `ref` field will be the unique identifier for this position within the specified Inventory Catalogue, as identified by the `catalogue` field.

The `InventoryPosition` is an orchestrateable entity. Events for these should specify a parent entity of Inventory Catalogue.

**Backward Compatibility Note**

With the introduction of Global Inventory, we have introduced new data structures to support this functionality. Existing orchestration enabled clients will have access to their existing product based data via the `COMPATIBILITY:` catalogue.

For more information, please refer to the Backward Compatibility Guide on Lingo

fields.name: createOrder
fields.description:
This mutation creates an `Order`, an orchestratable entity inside the Fluent ecosystem. If the `Order` is successfully created, a CREATE event will be generate associated with the mutation.
A sample of the event generated:
{
    "name": "CREATE",
    "type": "NORMAL",
    "entityRef": "ORDER-001",
    "entityType": "ORDER",
    "retailerId": "1",
    "accountId": "ACCOUNT_ID"
}

types.name: CreateSettingInput
types.description:
Input type to create a `Setting`

**USAGE**
Use a unique combination of `context` and `contextId` to create settings for various contexts. Not using a unique combination of those two will result in a _ConstraintViolationException_.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Name of the setting

inputFields.name: valueType
inputFields.description: Data type of the setting's value. Supported types are _LOB_, _STRING_, _INTEGER_, _BOOLEAN_ and _JSON_.

inputFields.name: lobValue
inputFields.description: Value of the setting. Use this if the value is a JSON.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: Value of the setting. Use this if the value is NOT a JSON.

inputFields.name: context
inputFields.description: The context of the setting. Supported values are ACCOUNT, RETAILER, AGENT or CUSTOMER

inputFields.name: contextId
inputFields.description: `ID` of the context type. For instance, use a retailer's ID when using _RETAILER_ context.

types.name: UpdateSettingInput
types.description:
Input type to update a `Setting`

**USAGE**
Use a unique combination of `context` and `contextId` to create settings for various contexts. Not using a unique combination of those two will result in a _ConstraintViolationException_.

**NOTE**
If you are an existing client, you may already be using our Configuration Settings feature. You can still use this API to update existing settings. However, we advise you to be very cautious in doing so as _V4_ APIs may behave unexpectedly if you modify your existing settings. If you have questions, please contact support.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: ID of the object

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Name of the setting

inputFields.name: valueType
inputFields.description: Data type of the setting's value. Supported types are _LOB_, _STRING_, _INTEGER_, _BOOLEAN_ and _JSON_.

inputFields.name: lobValue
inputFields.description: Value of the setting. Use this if the value is a JSON.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: Value of the setting. Use this if the value is NOT a JSON.

inputFields.name: context
inputFields.description: The context of the setting. Supported values are ACCOUNT, RETAILER, AGENT or CUSTOMER

inputFields.name: contextId
inputFields.description: `ID` of the context type. For instance, use a retailer's ID when using _RETAILER_ context.

types.name: CreateProductCatalogueInput
types.description:
Input parameter for the `createProductCatalogue` mutation. The `ref` field will be the unique identifier for this catalogue.

The following default values will be set on creation: * `status` = `CREATED` * `workflowRef` = `PRODUCT_CATALOGUE::` * `workflowVersion` = `.` .

After data persistence, an orchestration event will be fired providing the opportunity to perform business logic within a workflow.

**Backward Compatibility Note**

With the introduction of Global Inventory, we have introduced new data structures to support this functionality. Existing orchestration enabled clients will have access to their existing product based data via the `COMPATIBILITY:` catalogue.

For more information, please refer to the Backward Compatibility Guide on Lingo

types.name: UpdateProductCatalogueInput
types.description:
Input parameter for the `updateProductCatalogue` mutation. The `ref` field is the unique identifier for the catalogue you wish to update.

During an update mutation, the following fields behave in an "UPSERT" or UPDATE / INSERT manner: * `attributes` - `name` is the unique key for the Attribute `type` and `value`. If an associated Attribute with a matching `name` already exists, then the `type` and `value` fields will be updated, else it will be inserted. **Backward Compatibility Note**

With the introduction of Global Inventory, we have introduced new data structures to support this functionality. Existing orchestration enabled clients will have access to their existing product based data via the `COMPATIBILITY:` catalogue.

For more information, please refer to the Backward Compatibility Guide on Lingo

types.name: UpdateGroupProductInput
types.description:
Input parameter for the `updateGroupProduct` mutation. A group product `ref` is unique within the bounds of the specified `catalogue`, which together makes up the unique identifier for the `GroupProduct` record.

During an update mutation, the following fields behave in an "UPSERT" or UPDATE / INSERT manner: * `attributes` - `name` is the unique key for the Attribute `type` and `value`. If an associated Attribute with a matching `name` already exists, then the `type` and `value` fields will be updated, else it will be inserted. * `prices` - `type` and `currency` are the unique key for the Price `value`. If an associated Price with a matching `name` and `type` already exists, then the `value` field will be updated, else it will be inserted. **Backward Compatibility Note**

With the introduction of Global Inventory, we have introduced new data structures to support this functionality. Existing orchestration enabled clients will have access to their existing product based data via the `COMPATIBILITY:` catalogue.

For more information, please refer to the Backward Compatibility Guide on Lingo

types.name: CreateDecisionTableInput
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Input type for creating a new decision table

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Name of the table. Please provide a name that will help in identifying the decision table.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: Description of the decision table.

inputFields.name: rules
inputFields.description: A connection of `DecisionRule`s. A decision rule is a set of conditions with the corresponding actions. The actions are performed if the conditions evaluate to true.So rules can be created in a single mutation while creating the table. But they can be added later too.

types.name: CreateDecisionRuleWithDecisionTableInput
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Input type for creating a new decision rule with a decision table

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: A short description of the rule. Helpful to understand the behaviour when the rule itself is complicated.

inputFields.name: inputs
inputFields.description: A set of conditions that all need to be true for the input to evaluate to true.

inputFields.name: outputs
inputFields.description:
A set of actions to be taken when the input evaluates to true.
Note: The type is list for future support. Currently we support only one action. If user configures more than one output, the first one in the array will be executed and the rest will be ignored.

inputFields.name: priority
inputFields.description: The priority decides which rule to execute in case of a conflict between multiple rules. The rule with the highest priority (represented by lowest number) will be selected. If no priority is provided, each rule will get a priority of 100 by default.

types.name: CreateDecisionRuleInputInput
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Input type for `DecisionRuleInput`. Sorry about the awkward naming in this case but that's the naming convention.

inputFields.name: inputExpression
inputFields.description: The left hand side of a condition equation. At the moment, the actions are executed only when the inputExpression evaluates to true. So, it should be designed such that the true value should lead to the execution of the action.

inputFields.name: inputEntries
inputFields.description: This represents the right hand side of the condition equation. It includes the input values.

types.name: CreateDecisionRuleInputExpressionInput
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

The input expression. At the moment, output actions are executed when DecisionRuleInputExpression evaluates to true. So, this should be designed such that it evaluates to true for the corresponding action to be performed. Note: A rule can have multiple input expressions chained together with logical operators. Currently the api uses the "AND" operator to chain multiple input expressions within a rule.

inputFields.name: fieldName
inputFields.description: The fieldName from the GraphQL type

inputFields.name: operator
inputFields.description: The comparison operator

types.name: CreateDecisionRuleInputEntriesInput
types.description: _Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

inputFields.name: stringEntries
inputFields.description: Values that the input expression will be compared to. To be used when values of the corresponding fields are strings. For example, value of Product.Ref will be string or a value that can be passed and converted into a string.

types.name: CreateDecisionRuleOutputInput
types.description:
_Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

Type to configure a set of actions which are executed when the decision rule input evaluates to true

inputFields.name: outputExpression
inputFields.description: The output expression. At the moment, we execute actions/outputs when DecisionRuleInputExpression evaluates to true. So, this should be designed such that this will always be executed when the input evaluates to true. Also note that even though we don't support multiple outputs at the moment, the schema type is designed this way to be future proof.

inputFields.name: outputEntries
inputFields.description: This represents the values that the output expression will be compared to.

types.name: CreateDecisionRuleOutputExpressionInput
types.description: _Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

inputFields.name: action
inputFields.description: The action to be executed

types.name: CreateDecisionRuleOutputEntriesInput
types.description: _Disclaimer: This type is in closed Beta and relates to an upcoming feature Virtual Views which will be released later this year. Should you wish to get early access, please contact your account manager_

inputFields.name: intEntry
inputFields.description: Values that the output expression will be compared to. To be used when the values are a single Int. For example, for the Output "Apply a quantity buffer of 10, this is the `10` part.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a schema IDL definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a scalar IDL definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an object IDL definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field IDL definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field argument IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an interface IDL definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an union IDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object field IDL definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.
